name: High Mire
role_in_state: Source of ritual reagents and specialized wetland materials
culture_adjustments: raft-clan kinship stronger than river-house ties
labor calendar keyed to peat-thaw rather than flood-crest
secretive foraging rites controlled by local guilds
taboos on open burning; peat-smoke ritualized
oral navigational lore emphasizes poling and peat-channels
constraints: poor overland access; waterways seasonally choked
limited arable land â€” grain output low
guild monopolies restrict free trade in reagents
notes: key supplier for the state's ritual-reagent commerce
few large burgs; dispersed bog-houses and processing camps
bog-burial sites reinforce ancestor cult authority
